alert.note: Alert for Adams; Scioto (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 1:53PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN LEWIS, SOUTHEASTERN ADAMS AND SOUTHWESTERN SCIOTO COUNTIES THROUGH 230 PM EDT... At 153 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Vanceburg, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Portsmouth, New Boston, Vanceburg, Rosemount, Rome, Sandy Springs, Buena Vista in Scioto County, Saint Paul, Firebrick, West Portsmouth, Turkey Creek Lake, Friendship, Garrison and Rexton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
